name: Travelodge London Liverpool Street

reviews.text: I travel to London for business fairly frequently and usually stay in the Crowne Plaza in Shoreditch. However due - apparently - to a huge trade fair taking place in the city this week, hotel accomodation was extremely limited. One of the only hotels available was the Travelodge Liverpool Street which, being mere minutes from my office, I booked with low expectations.
reviews.title: More hostel than hotel

reviews.text: On arriving at the Travelodge to check at 5pm I found a scene of mild chaos. There was a line of 4 customers waiting to check in, 3 staff behind the desk but no communication between the two groups. The desk staff were either on the telephone, urgently flicking through sheets of print outs, or banging the automated check-in machines by the desk in a vain and misguided attempt to fix them. After 15 minutes eventually it became clear that their computer system was down, so they had lost details of all bookings. Customers were asked to score out their names on a piece of paper, and then advise the desk staff of the room rate. The man who checked in before me re-appeared at the front desk 2 minutes after being given his keycard to complain that his room had already been allocated to someone else - someone else who he had just walked in on! The receptionists response? 'I know'! Incredible. This made me feel immediately unsafe in the hotel even before I had completed check-in.
reviews.title: Good price & location

reviews.text: Eventually I was given my keycard - without any indication of which room I was in or how to get there other than the number written on the paper folder holding the card - and made my way up the stairs to the first floor. At the top of the stairs was a sign - 'The bar on this floor is open all night'. NOT what you want to see when you need a good nights sleep.
reviews.title: A London budget hotel - so not much for a lot of money

reviews.text: The room was the very definition of basic - a very low double bed with a paper-thin mattress and pillows, a small bathroom with shower, and a desk area with a tiny television and a kettle. Depressing but functional. However a deep rumbling shook the hotel every 5/6 minutes from 10 oclock - I assumed this was a close by overground or underground train - shouting from the hallway, and the knowledge that the front desk were giving away keycards to already allocated rooms meant that my nights sleep was anything but good.
reviews.title: good location but unclean room

reviews.text: Even with my initial low expectations I was shocked at how basic, dirty, noisy and badly run the Travelodge Liverpool Street was. The location - 5 minutes walk from Liverpool Street station - is the only saving grace, and the only reason I can imagine someone would contemplate booking this hotel (especially at £132 a night)
reviews.title: Think twice

reviews.text: Not a very friendly welcome. My friend told them there were 2 of us yet they only put towels in for 1. There was no bath mat at all. No shampoo, glass, anything!!! Very basic all round. Small bath. We went out about 630pm, it was terrential rain and we asked for a cab... the chap on reception said we should go outside and wait.... in the rain for a black cab! when we said cant you call us a cab he said we should walk... the bottom line was we walked in the rain to where we had to go.. got soaked through.
reviews.title: Only stay if really necessary!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not helpful or friendly. Very basic room. My friend booked this ages ago, so it was reasonable, but we looked online and it would have been £199 for the night!!!!
reviews.title: Cheap and cheerful

reviews.text: We managed to get a very good deal so the price was about a third of the usual amount, making it reasonable for the state of the place. Nothing special but of course we've learned not to expect a lot from Travelodges. They had new electronic check-in computers which made it quick and easy. The location is excellent for East London and the City, but quite a way from the West End if that's where you're headed. They had a jug of water out on the check in desk for when you came in in the evening (it was a very hot day) which did impress me. Average room with little or no decoration and no bed side tables (this is becoming standard in travelodges apparently...). Lots of noise from the building directly opposite first thing in the morning and of course it being so hot, we had no choice but to have the window open as there was no fan. Overall nothing special but worth it if you can find yourself a good deal.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for :-)

reviews.text: Arrived at 12 (paid for early check in) checked in nice and smoothly, we had room 525, had booked for 2 adults and 2 children but only 1 bed had been made up and only 1 set of towels left, asked the room attendant who was in corridor for extra sheets and towels etc she was very apologetic and promised all would be ready when we returned, which is was :)
reviews.title: not the usual standard

reviews.text: Room was clean no stains on carpet, bathroom clean and tidy. The only major problem was with the window, it had been vandalized at some point and wouldn't close properly so we could hear noise all night from outside the hotel, added to the fact that the doors were being slammed on our floor till 4.20am i did not get much sleep.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: This was our first stay at this particular travelodge, having stayed previously with the same company but in the Kings Cross area (which was ok-ish)
reviews.title: brilliant central location and V.reasonable

reviews.text: We found it briliantly located for central and west london,good transport links and the usual consistently good standard of rooms and amenities.Staff were polite & helpful.
reviews.title: reasonable!

reviews.text: Bit busy on a weekday morning around 9-ish as (rush hour) as major financial dictrict nearby!
reviews.title: Great for overnight stop

reviews.text: stayed here for 2 nights 15th and 16th september. paid £120 for 2 nights, got what we paid for i thought. very central and extremely quiet as it is beside offices. very basic but i think you expect that from this type of accomodation. would stay again for a few nights as its cheap and handy to everything.
reviews.title: fine for the price
Expensive hotel, budget service
reviews.text: We booked two rooms in this travelodge out of desperation as we were visiting London to go to the Paralympics. We only stayed one night. I use to be a fan of travelodges but over the years they have become tired & in some cases dirty & very disappointing,I really was not looking forward to staying.
Please remember its just a Travelodge.
reviews.title: Honest

reviews.text: But.... With ever rising prices that can always cover them. And standards souls be more.
reviews.title: Honest Review

reviews.text: I have to say for a good central location and £10 cheaper than the two others Travelodge around the corner.
reviews.title: Good location..but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although tricky for parking.
reviews.title: the skankiest and worst hotel in london - avoid!! cheapo hotel for extortionate prices!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all ok hotel, didn't eat there or use the bar but shops near by.
reviews.title: Hotel 3 star, Zach braff 5 star

description: Hotel offering modern accommodations & amenities; situated in the London Congested Zone; easy access to central London.
